item.description: There is a growing unease that the college’s current trajectory is unsustainable.

item.title: Trump administration says Kilmar Abrego Garcia is ineligible for asylum
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security released immigration court documents that outline its arguments against Abrego Garcia applying for asylum or receiving it.

item.title: Victim used hand signal to ask for help with escaping domestic violence situation, police say
item.description: Authorities say a good Samaritan helped a woman escape a domestic violence situation at a convenience store after used subtle hand signals to alert for help.

item.title: ‘His loss is deeply felt’: College student dies after collapsing at cross-country practice
item.description: A college cross-country athlete in Texas died after he collapsed during practice, the school announced.

item.title: Divers searching for clues in missing persons cases discover over 90 cars in river
item.description: More than 90 cars were found in the Chicago River system this week.

item.title: Sea turtle nesting season nearing an end on Anna Maria Island, watchers say
item.description: Anna Maria Island Turtle Watch says only 100 nests remain on the island’s beaches.

item.title: Former Green Bay Packers quarterback accused of choking bartender
item.description: A former Green Bay Packers quarterback was cited in Wisconsin for reportedly choking an employee at an area bar.

item.title: Amish mother indicted by grand jury in ‘spiritual delusion’ drowning death of 4-year-old son
item.description: A Tuscarawas County Grand Jury has indicted an Amish mother accused of drowning her young son.

item.title: Hall of Fame wide receiver Randy Moss completes cancer treatment
item.description: Pro Football Hall of Famer Randy Moss recently completed his cancer treatment in Charlotte.

item.title: Why more Americans are turning to digital banks
item.description: Digital banks are surging – often advertising higher yields and fewer fees. So, how do you pick the right one for your money? Consumer Investigator Caresse Jackman talks with The Motley Fool about what to look for before you move your cash.
